sentences.en: For 3 years he lived in the limelight.
his few moments of limelight in front of the cameras
sentences.cn: 他为数不多的几次成为镜头焦点的时刻

sentences.en: I hated the limelight and found it unbearable.
sentences.cn: 我讨厌惹人注目,觉得那实在令人难以忍受.

sentences.en: It is wiser to keep out of the limelight.
Now, Bert, quit hogging the limelight.
She accused her co - star of trying to hog the limelight.
sentences.cn: 她指责合演的明星企图抢占风头.

sentences.en: She has long held the limelight in the dramatic world.
sentences.cn: 她长久以来在戏剧界受人注目.

sentences.en: She is in the limelight anywhere.
She seems fond of the limelight.
She’s afraid this new actor will steal the limelight from her.
sentences.cn: 她担心这位新演员会抢去她的风头。

sentences.en: The experimental car certainly stole the limelight at the motor show.
sentences.cn: 这实验车理所当然地在汽车展中出尽了风头.

sentences.en: The politician is in the limelight showing off.
sentences.cn: 这位政客是个在众人面前爱出风头的人.

sentences.en: They share the limelight by telling stories about star performers.
sentences.cn: 他们通过讲述明星表现者的故事来分享“星光”.

sentences.en: Tony has now been thrust into the limelight, with a high-profile job.
sentences.cn: 托尼现在一下子成了众人关注的中心，因为他有一份经常出镜、见报的工作。

sentences.en: Why have you stayed completely out of the limelight?
sentences.cn: 为什么你一直不愿意为人们所关注?

sentences.en: You enjoy the limelight and would rather shine than hide your light.
sentences.cn: 而且你很享受被人关注的感觉,不喜欢掩盖自己的光芒.

trans.tran_en: a situation in which someone receives a lot of attention, especially from newspapers, television etc

trans.tran_cn: 使显露头角，使受到注目
